name: Emperor of Fire and Iron
desc:
Emperor of Fire and Iron

One of the two sovereigns who once stood at the apex of the aberrant species of the Fontemer. An Armored Crab that has avoided predation, and has constantly partook in hunting and eating. Its imperial title is made half in awe, and half in jest.

value.name: Molten Mail
value.desc:
Emperor of Fire and Iron: Molten Mail

"Imagine this world: All of humanity has been purged from Teyvat, and the ever-growing Emperor of Fire and Iron eventually wears the Palais Mermonia upon its body like a luxurious coat of white stone."

value.text: Reward for accepting the Tavern Challenge at The Cat's Tail and claiming victory in a Friendly Fracas with the Emperor of Fire and Iron

value.name: Emperor of Fire and Iron
value.desc:
One of the two sovereigns who once stood at the apex of the aberrant species of the Fontemer, and the subject of many a tale among sailors.

An Armored Crab that avoids predation, and can keep hunting and eating, will continue to grow, continually seeking out suitable shells to become its new armor. But eventually, it became simply too gargantuan. Before the first diluvian period, a massive Armored Crab once attacked a ship, and was finally forced back into the depths by Basil Elton, who had not yet been reinstated as a naval commander.

Imagine this world: All of humanity has been purged from Teyvat, and the ever-growing Emperor of Fire and Iron eventually wears the Palais Mermonia upon its body like a luxurious coat of white stone. Of course, in such a world, there naturally would be no one to call it, half-jokingly and half in awe, the "Emperor of Fire and Iron."

customize.name: Emperor of Fire and Iron
customize.desc:
Emperor of Fire and Iron

One of the two sovereigns who once stood at the apex of the aberrant species of the Fontemer. An Armored Crab that has avoided predation, and has constantly partook in hunting and eating. Its imperial title is made half in awe, and half in jest.

customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

customize.text: Can also be exchanged using a

customize.name: Blank Dynamic Card
customize.desc: A blank card with a painted back. It is said that if you put the name of your desired dynamic card on this blank card, you can get the very skin from the Association agent located at the tavern.

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Friendly Fracas - The Emperor of Fire and Iron Tolls the Bell

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow." "A cat friend of mine who travels with humans told me that huge crabs live on the beaches of Fontaine, and the sound of their leader clicking its claws is like the clamorous tolling of a bell..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: The Emperor of Fire and Iron is immune to Frozen, Stun, and Petrification, and when it uses Elemental Bursts, it will gain 3 Armored Crab Carapace stacks. When the Action Phase begins, if the Emperor does not have Armored Crab Carapace equipped, it will gain 3 stacks of said Carapace.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Serious Showdown - Emperor of Fire and Iron's Mighty Quake

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow, meow." "If the slumber of the giant crabs' leader is disturbed, it will spout flames in fury. Any poor cats standing too near would probably faint from the shock..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: The Emperor of Fire and Iron is immune to Frozen, Stun, and Petrification, and when it uses Elemental Bursts, it will gain 6 Armored Crab Carapace stacks. When the Action Phase begins, if the Emperor does not have Armored Crab Carapace equipped, it will gain 3 stacks of said Carapace.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

customize.name: Emperor of Fire and Iron
customize.desc:
Emperor of Fire and Iron

One of the two sovereigns who once stood at the apex of the aberrant species of the Fontemer. An Armored Crab that has avoided predation, and has constantly partook in hunting and eating. Its imperial title is made half in awe, and half in jest.

customize.text:
*Has 24 HP
<color=#ffffffd9>Prerequisite</color>
Complete 3 challenge objective(s) in The Emperor of Fire and Iron Tolls the Bell

It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill</color>
Deals 1 <color=#ff9999>Pyro DMG</color> . If this character has at least 7 <color=#ffffff>Armored Crab Carapace</color> stacks, this DMG +1.
After that, this character gains 2 <color=#ffffff>Armored Crab Carapace</color> stacks.
<color=#ece5d8>Armored Crab Carapace</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
Each stack provides 1 <color=#ffffff>Shield</color> to protect the equipped character.

<color=#ffd780>Elemental Burst</color>
This character's <color=#ffffff>Prepare Skill</color> : <color=#ffffff>Searing Blast</color> .
<color=#ece5d8>Searing Blast</color>
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Burst</color>
(Prepare for 1 turn)
Deals 1 <color=#ff9999>Pyro DMG</color> , deals 2 <color=#ffffff>Piercing DMG</color> to all opposing standby characters. This skill deals +1 <color=#ff9999>Pyro DMG</color> for every 2 <color=#ffffff>Armored Crab Carapace</color> stacks this character has.
<color=#ece5d8>Armored Crab Carapace</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
Each stack provides 1 <color=#ffffff>Shield</color> to protect the equipped character.

<color=#ffd780>Passive Skill</color>
(Passive) <color=#ffffff>When combat begins:</color> Gain 5 initial <color=#ffffff>Armored Crab Carapace</color> stacks.
<color=#ffffff>After your side performs any action:</color> If your side has any <color=#ffffff>Shield</color> Status or <color=#ffffff>Shield</color> Combat Status other than Armored Crab Carapace, these other effects will be canceled. For each effect canceled, this character gains 2 <color=#ffffff>Armored Crab Carapace</color> stacks.
<color=#ece5d8>Armored Crab Carapace</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
Each stack provides 1 <color=#ffffff>Shield</color> to protect the equipped character.

Applies Pyro and can trigger the following Elemental Reactions:
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> + <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> <color=#ffffff>]</color> <color=#ffffff>Melt</color> : DMG +2 for this instance
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> + <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>]</color> <color=#ffffff>Vaporize</color> : DMG +2 for this instance
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> + <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> <color=#ffffff>]</color> <color=#ffffff>Overloaded</color> : DMG +2 for this instance, the target is forcibly switched to the next character
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> + <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> <color=#ffffff>]</color> <color=#ffffff>Burning</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Burning Flame</color> ] that will deal 1 Pyro DMG at the end of the Round (Takes effect once, max 2 stacks)

<color=#ece5d8>Physical DMG</color>
Physical DMG will not apply any Elements, nor can it engage in Elemental Reactions.
<color=#ece5d8>Shield</color>
This Shield will be consumed to protect the character who equips it from DMG.
<color=#ece5d8>Prepare Skill</color>
Some Skills cannot be used directly. Instead, they need to be <color=#ffffff>prepared</color> over a certain number of turns.
When it is a certain player's turn, and this player's active character is currently <color=#ffffff>preparing</color> a Skill, this player's turn will be skipped. If the Skill has finished being <color=#ffffff>prepared</color> , the character will directly use that Skill at this time. (Skills that require <color=#ffffff>preparing</color> cannot activate effects triggered by "using a Skill" or "triggering an Elemental Reaction" or other such effects.)
Only active characters can <color=#ffffff>prepare</color> Skills, and if an active character who is <color=#ffffff>preparing</color> a Skill gets switched off-field, their <color=#ffffff>preparation</color> will be interrupted.
<color=#ece5d8>Piercing DMG</color>
Piercing DMG cannot be increased by any bonuses, but cannot be defended against using Shields or DMG Immunity either.
